column4: hi - i am wondering what apps you guys might recommend on ubuntu for time-tracking. I.e. i would like to track single tasks in my daily workflow in categories like: doing mail, doing research etc
i stumpled upon hamster right now - which seems ...ok ... but its the only app i tested so far
it would be great if the app would let me generate reports
it does not tell you what to do, but you can look at what you have done before
yep it does - but then again it does it NOT in categories
it does it on file-system layer iirc
so - its not really usefull for time-tracking - but for file-usage history or am i wrong?
well perhaps you could schedule some tasks in evolution calender
using cron for time-tracking sounds ....well like using os2 nowadays
os2 was fine - but you wouldnt consider it today in99,99% of all cases ;)
os2 is still being used today :P
yep - but not in most cases ...see 99,99% ;)
IBM loves it for their old tape robotics
anyway it was just an example - i am looking for time-tracking apps - not manual hacks offering some workaround for not having a real solution ;)
thanks ...lets see if theres something new.
